intro: Elatostema nanchuanense var. nanchuanense, commonly known as the Nanchuan Elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Nanchuan region, and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically appearing in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
